lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Hello, everyone, and welcome to this evening's episode of Critical Role, where a bunch of us voice actors get together and roll dice like we're awesome nerd people, which we are. So, welcome! We're going to do a couple quick announcements here before we kick things off. You want to go ahead and start?

lines.name: ZAC
lines.text: So tomorrow night on Gather Your Party, it will be Stef and Jessica's birthday, we're going to be throwing a birthday party, and I'm going to let them shave my face in whatever you guys vote on, as a birthday present to them.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So many things.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The possibilities are endless.

lines.name: ZAC
lines.text: A lot.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It is thick, too. You can get some nice dimension in there.

lines.name: ZAC
lines.text: Great.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Words, shave words in--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You could build a bear in the beard.

lines.name: ZAC
lines.text: I could build a bear. Yeah. Great.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Can we shave off bits and then re-apply them to other parts of the face?

lines.name: ZAC
lines.text: If you want to wear them, yeah!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay! I might do that, yeah.

lines.name: ZAC
lines.text: And then this weekend, Nerdist is running a 24-hour livestream for Extra Life. You guys may recognize some of the faces that stop by. They are going to be streaming from our set. So, let's welcome them. We'll be hosting it, but I encourage you guys all to head over to Nerdist, twitch.tv/nerdist. This weekend it'll be Saturday from 9AM to 9PM Pacific Standard Time. I will be there the whole time helping out, as well as some of our other Geek and Sundry hosts. So you guys should check that out and help them be part of our team, raising money for Extra Life. And Matt, I wanted to thank you for helping us make Battle of the Bands a success last week. We all know that the voting was rigged and that's why your team won, but it was a valiant effort nonetheless. And if you guys enjoyed that, you should tweet at Geek and Sundry's twitter and let them know, and we will try to do things like that for you more in the future. That's pretty much all I have. Let's get to 10k and get this stupid stuff off my face.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Thank you very much, Zac. Speaking of shaving, let me take a moment here to mourn the Mercer-beard. Those who saw on twitter. I was trying to hold off until 10k and Halloween for my costume, but due to work, had to shave it as of last night. So, I apologize. I'm in mourning. So please bear with me for this evening, going forward. Couple announcements. Critical Role-related: we have a lot of our party in transit right now. Laura and Travis just flew in from Toronto and will probably be a little bit late to the game. Sam is currently heading here from a session and will get here as soon as possible. Unfortunately, Orion will not be joining us again this evening, but hope to have him back next week for Halloween. So, things will get rolling as they arrive. Thankfully, we're at a situation in the game where I don't think it'll be too halting. We shall see. Next announcement, we're putting out Critical Role thematic playlists. All the players have put together playlists of Spotify songs that they feel encapture aspects of their character and their character's journeying as Vox Machina and in the world of Exandria. So those will be releasing every week, starting tonight at 8PM with Percy, I believe. So Taliesin's playlist will be up available on Geek and Sundry's website and--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Dropping mad jams-- I'm not.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: They're mad, you're allowed.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to show you some music.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's good. Go download Spotify right now, so you can go, if you haven't. It's free!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There you go.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's cancer. It's been a weird weeknight.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It has. It's been a long day.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I had a strange day. I've infected friends with Spotify now.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Feedback is always welcome, and I will be updating it on the website as feedback comes in and balancing is tweaked for it. But have at it, have fun, hope you guys enjoy it. I had a good time creating it, and it's a good time. Also, just a reminder to you guys: our official Critical Role t-shirts are available on the Geek and Sundry website store if you want to wear any of the awesome red shirts that we've shown on the show with our full-on Critical Role logo. Shown in an exemplary dark, fine ink. Those are available for purchase.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And keychains.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: What if, due to some strange third-arm syndrome, I can't wear t-shirts; is there any way I can show my support to the show?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes, you can. We have necklaces and keychains with our logo as well. Also available on the store. So, you're welcome to check those out.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: With my third arm, I need necklaces and keychains.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Three-armed shirts are coming in 2016.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, three-armed shirts will be on the docket. Thank you, Liam, I was trying to get to that.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: There's a new shirt up. I didn't know that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We have a new shirt up?

lines.name: OFFSTAGE
lines.text: How do you want to do this.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Maybe not Liam. Everyone but Liam can look weird. There's no way to help you.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Can I just interject for a second only because I'm hot as hell. I just want to thank @pupgames on twitter for making me this fabulous stealthy cloak. I'm going to take it off in about two minutes, because it's more t-shirt weather here in the studio. So I'll just let everybody bask in the glow of my absence of light for two minutes, and then I'm going to switch to t-shirt mode.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You're so stealthy.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Where'd Liam go?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's mysterious.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Holy shit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All righty. Also, our cast interviews on the Geek and Sundry website are almost over. Orion's went up today and those will be finishing up shortly.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: But we have Spotify lists to replace them.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yep, Spotify lists coming up.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So there's still more content.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If you've missed any of the cast interviews, they're all available on the website. So feel free to check them out.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Marisha, you wanted to follow up on the 826LA news you had.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So 826LA and Young Storytellers are actually partnering together, and they're in this contest right now. You have to go vote, and they could potentially win $100,000. Which: awesome. And we've got Critters. I think they'll win. So you have to go vote. I tweeted the link, so the mods, go find it on my twitter, or you can just search #LA2050, and you should be able to find it. So, yeah, go vote.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Team Hooman, Critters, come up there and make this happen.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Also, they just announced they're going to be opening an 826LA-- sorry, not 826LA, but an 826 in San Francisco!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Awesome!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Another 826 in San Francisco?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, is there another, I guess so.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, because there's one there--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: They might be opening a second one.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: They might be opening-- that would make sense.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I think they said they announced they're opening one. I think.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm retweeting you right now.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay. Taliesin's retweeting me.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So there you go. Follow either of their twitters to get the information.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: But, go vote. Help them win 100k.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, Taliesin, you wanted to mention something about Tara's--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's going to be really exciting. And--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, it's like about a g*psy girl, and it's got a bunch of recipes, and it teaches you how to make a bow, and has herb cards and all sorts of cool stuff. I was into it immediately.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: For the cool child in your life this Christmas. This would be for the kid who needs something that's not quite outdoors, but not quite a video game.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Zartana.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Zartana.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There you go.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Also, I will be in OniCon in Galveston, Texas over Halloween. So, if you're in Galveston, Texas and it's Halloween, and you want to go to an anime con, I'll be there. And I'll be in costume, and it will be pretty hilarious.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And last, but not least, last Thursday while we were here, looking at dead versions of ourselves hanging from a tree, Super Power Beat Down won a Geekie!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh! Mazel tov!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, glad I came here instead of going to the award show. Totally worth it. But we won a Geekie. So, I thought I should say that.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well-earned.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Thanks.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You nerd.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Good on you.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You should wear it like bling. Get a chain for it. That'd be great.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Just, once again, like, it-- No.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No. No, never mind.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All righty, any other announcements anyone needs to make?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: God damn it, it keeps happening.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm good.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And welcome back. So, everyone, our Sam arrived--

lines.name: SAM, TALIESIN
lines.text: Samurai?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: While she is down there, essentially meditating with the barren roots of the Sun Tree, is there anything you guys would wish to do, or are you just waiting for her to complete her ritual?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well, there are options.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What do we need? We have to get water, right? There was some issue about-- we don't have any water, do we?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Was that an issue?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I don't remember. There was some wells around.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can I do a few checks while I'm preparing the ritual to see if this is a curse over this tree?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go ahead and make a religion check, I guess.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Not great. Hang on, my ring of protection is in the way. Nine.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nine. Honestly, it's hard to tell if it's a curse, the tree itself is just dead. You are very well-connected with the natural essences of the world, the life essence of plants and natural growth. All of your interactions with the Sun Tree are devoid of any response. It seems dead where it stands. But, as you continue your ritual--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: God, I hope this works.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Anyone else have anything they want to do?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Because I can't remember. It's probably wrong. I'm going to take all daggers out of my Blinkback Belt except for the Keen Dagger and replace them with wooden stakes that I purchased. And I'm going to spend an hour or so, whatever it takes to-- I've got partial gloves on; I'm going to take that symbol of Sarenrae and I'm going to take as much time as it needs to sew it so that it is fixed firmly to the back of my right hand. I tell Grog that I'm going to go down below and check, and I follow the path all the way down to find-- I think everyone else is down there.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh hi, Vax.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I step over Scanlan's head and I kneel down by Keyleth and gently place a hand on her shoulder and say: What do you need? What can I get?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I don't really know. I don't know if this is going to work, to be totally honest. The tree is dead. Do you have any of that holy water?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I got holy oil. Not water.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do I have holy water? I don't know if I took one or not. I can't remember.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If you didn't write it down, it's not in your inventory.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm pretty good about that. I don't think I took one.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: In the meantime, there are options.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I got two. I remember it. It was two vials of holy oil. I gave one to my sister, and I have the other. If you think it will help, you take it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Do you need me to get water?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, let's get some water.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Stuff that was abandoned when whoever previously was the owner of this tavern either left Whitestone or fell to a worse fate. But there was no plain water to drink.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm going to go out into the street. I'm going to find water.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I can show you where there's water.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I lived here my whole life.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Are you guys disguised?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, we all are.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They're still technically under your Seeming spell, for the next few hours, at least.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, we cannot let that go.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Does that have a range? No, it just lasts.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As far as I know, it lasts just for an eight-hour period. I'll double-check.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Percival, do you want to come upstairs to the window, and--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm coming.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, it lasts for eight hours and allows you to change the appearance of--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Great. We're still peasants.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Remember, we also have Heroes' Feast up.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, okay.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Advantages on wisdom throws and whatnot.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Hit point bonus, advantage on wisdom throws--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah. 2d10 hit points. Max hit points.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I have my advantages still. So I'm going to lead them to the closest well.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Stealthily?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm going to start-- I've kind of cleared out around the roots.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's a lot. It's earth and then giant roots from a very large tree that go past. You aren't at the bottom of the roots. You've met the roots as you were carving through. They go even deeper than where you are right now.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah. Can I start carving a little ravine around it for where we're going to start pouring the water?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If you've already started the eight-hour process of the secondary spell, you would not be able to really interrupt that to be able to continue another spell you've been doing. I could say that you did that as part of your preparation for the roots. That's fine. That's fine. It'd be a small ravine, because you also don't want to--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Damage anything.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: But you manage to get a bucket up, and you pull it up and check it and it looks clear. You take the water back with you to the tavern. Seemingly uneventful. You guys have managed to stay far enough out of sight. Nothing seems to caught your attention.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay. Should we scout around and see if there's anything else around the hideout that we should be aware of, or any other hiding places, or safehouses?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I feel like we should probably bring a little more water than one bucket. So we should spend a little bit of time doing that. But maybe my sister and I can have a look around, see if there's anything that we've missed. Outside.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well, here's the question. There's three lordly houses that we have to avoid at all costs, for now. There's a few shops that if we feel might be in our best interest to scout out. I know where an old weapons depot used to be. We could check the temples to maybe see if we could maybe find some support to begin with.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Do we trust anyone here?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We need friends.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: There might be people I trust.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Is there a central meeting place?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: There's a temple.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Is that a place where you can really chat up brand new people? Or is there a pub? I guess it's not really a pub town, is it?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's not a pub town. And it's a place where you don't necessarily chat up new people, but maybe find some old ones.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay. We could go there.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Percival, we're on your turf, so I'll follow your lead.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Leave, maybe Grog and Vex to guard Keyleth.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. So, Keyleth, you're staying behind to finish the ritual?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm doing what I do best. And I focus all my energy on this thing.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Within the graveyard.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yes, the Zenith is the one I wanted to go to.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What's the other one?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: The other one is called The Lady's Chamber. It's a temple of Erathis.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That sounds fun.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I don't know anybody there.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I might!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's what I'm afraid-- they might know you, so no.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So the Lady's Chamber, the temple to Erathis, is more central to the city and is partially a courtyard, partially a half-dome amphitheater place of worship. You guys make your way through the city. I'll have you all roll stealth checks if you could.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We're not trying to hide, are we?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, if you're not trying to hide, then make deception checks instead.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Awesome possum.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I rolled an 18 for something.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Can I choose to hide instead of deceive?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If you'd like to.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, I'll hang a little bit back from them.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I was trying to be stealthy, as well.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Although I'm fine either way. 23.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm better deceiving.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So we have two folks staying to the shadows, best they can in broad daylight in a clustered city. And one child-looking pauper of a boy wandering through the city alone towards the graveyard. As you guys make your way through, staying off to the side, jumping, or running through buildings and staying off the main path, you walk along the central road to the far eastern side of Whitestone. A few folks come out during the day, some are carrying bundles of textile goods. There's one guy that has a small cart, and it looks like he's bringing tools and stuff either to or from a store of some kind. Gives you a curious look as if he hasn't seen you before but doesn't seem to--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: G'day, sir!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "G'day!" And just keeps rolling along, the wheels squeaking as he pushes up the road.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I wish I had a yo-yo.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: How about a wheel and stick?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, the wheel and stick would be good.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Eventually, you guys make your way to the far eastern side of Whitestone. This is where the boundary wall that surrounds most of the city from a defensive standpoint lies. There is the multiple exit points throughout this wall. You dart around the outskirts of it, being careful to avoid the pattern of the undead giants that are slowly stomping through the city, like these hulking sentinels that walk in a perpetual pattern through the town. You follow the winding path through the thick woods, just on the outside of the wall of the city itself. You sticking to the path in your open way, or do you want to join them in the side of the forest?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, I've got to stick with them, I guess, although I like being a young peasant boy. It's kind of fun. All right, I'll go with them.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: With a little bit of breeze that's blowing through, very, very cold breeze that blows through this part of the forest, it's opening a little bit, and (creak) against itself. You push through the gate--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Wait a minute, nope. Let me look. I'm just going to move in, ten feet ahead, and see what I see.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That is a 23 for perception.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You skirt up and look inside. And there's a handful of trees in little clusters here and there, but for the most part this old graveyard is flat land, with just stones set up throughout. The older stones have very little rhyme or reason to their placement. They're sporadically thrown around, fresher ones tend to be more clustered with family names. This definitely looks like something that was put here when the town was founded and has been slowly expanded over time, and it's not uniform.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I hiss back at Percy: is this the way to your temple?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (whispers) Yes.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Through here?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You do see, a little ways ahead in the center of this open barren area, there is a stone temple that has, from what little you can see, a bit of stained glass pattern to it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Do we knock?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Is it safe? Should we go up?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We go up to the doors, and give it a tug.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Percy walks up to the doors.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, all right.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: This is my neighborhood. I feel comfortable.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right, Papa, let's go.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You go to the doors of the temple, the large wooden doors. In them are carved this flaming wreath into the wood. It looks almost like the outer ring of the classical depiction of a sun and going across the sky where you can see the waving flames licking the sides of the actual doors. And it is a double door. As you tug on the handle at the front, it gives very little to you. You give a little more of a tug on it, not enough to gather attention, just enough to really see if it's just stuck, or if it's locked. And it appears that the doors are not opening.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And I look--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: This is what he does!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It is what I do. This is an old, old type of lock, hold on.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There is no lock, actually.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: There's no lock? Oh, but I rolled a natural 20. Does that help? Let me get through the door?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Suddenly, a lock appears! Utterly pickable! (laughter)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Utterly pickable! It's the most pickable lock I've ever seen!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There is no lock. It is barred from the other side. There is some heavy wooden plank that is currently set on the other side of the door.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, where's Grog when you need him?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So, with your expertise in these sort of circumstances, you know that with the proper placement of a long blade and enough strength and weight put at the right fulcrum point, you can probably shimmy it off, and it may take a little bit of teamwork to do so.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Do you have a shortsword?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Everything I have is short. I can just go in there and open it from the inside.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, right. I always forget.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's not concentration, so I can just jump in there.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Essentially.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Don't fuse with a church pew.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If you're referring to a Dimension Door--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Correct. It's not concentration, I don't think.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, it is not concentration.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: More of a sneeze.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can visualize it. It doesn't have to be a place you have seen yet.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I can say I want to go ten feet in that direction.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yep.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Before I do, why are we trying to get in here? I thought it was to meet people. I don't think there's anyone in there.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I would like to find out what happened.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay, good enough for me. I go in.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. (spoof) With a burst of dark purplish energy, Scanlan steps through the door, leaving no mark or trace behind. On the other side you hear this muffled (spoof) as he reappears on the opposite side, completing his transition. You appear now in the central worship hall of the Zenith temple. To each side of you, you can see there are windows, about ten foot wide, stained glass windows, about every ten feet around this pattern, it looks like three to each side. There are pews set up for the masses to come and sit and worship, but a lot of the pews have been pushed off to the side, set astray, some have been destroyed and ruined. There's a pile in the corner of a number of sundered and tattered pews. There is a red carpet that marks the center that goes all the way to what looks like a raised altar on the opposite side of the room. You can see that some of the stained glass further down has been shattered and broken, and a little bit of sunlight creeps through. You can see there is on the altar a large stone platform. It's hard to see from this distance. Make a perception check.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (muffled) Scanlan! Open the door.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We do have earrings. 17.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There appears to be something on the the altar in the distance, small and scattered about it, but from this distance, it's hard to make out the details. But you hear Vax muffled through the door.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right, how big is this thing that's keeping the door shut?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's about eight feet wide and about a foot-- eight feet long, about a foot wide and about six inches thick. A big old piece of wooden board.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: A couple hundred pounds?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I would say it probably weighs about 40 or 50 pounds.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: 40 or 50 pounds?!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's wood. It's porous.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And how high off the ground? Could I touch it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You could touch it. It gets to about your head, a little higher.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right. I'm going to try and lift it off.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go ahead a make a strength check. Athletics! Make this athletics.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Athletics? Hmm. Not good. 12!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (grunting) From this position, it's not even budging.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: All right, Scanlan, step back from the door a couple of paces. I'm going to stick a blade through the door.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's not going to do much. There's a big heavy thing.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Percy, can I borrow your blade?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I've never used this. I've had it since I created the character and I've never used this blade once. This is the most use it's ever gotten. I pull out this pristine piece of shit (laughs) I don't even remember. I think I found it in a dungeon. It's terrible.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What is it?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's a boarding sword, it was one of those little curved swords.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Right. A scimitar or falchion.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: A scimitar. But short. It was nothing, it was terrible.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's all we need.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah so. Get it in there.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Scanlan, grab some rags or something, wrap it around the blade. You're going to lift on your side; we're going to lift on this side.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I get the sharp side?!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I can't get the handle through the crack in the door.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right, let's just do it your way.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Got that Bigby's Hand, is that what you're saying?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, I've got a million things I could do.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Are any of them concentration spells?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Bigby's is probably concentration, but I've also got a potion of strength.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As a note, Seeming isn't concentration.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I thought it was.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No. You cast it and it lasts for eight hours. You don't need to worry about that.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, I want to follow this through.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Let's keep going.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: All right. Can we lift it together?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughs) We can try. All right, so. This is going to be the three of you as a skill challenge, I want all three of you to roll. Not athletics, just a straight strength roll.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: One, two, three.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Add your strength modifier.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, I cut my hand!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Which is exactly what happens.

lines.name: TALIESIN, LIAM
lines.text: Bigby's Hand? Bigby's Hand!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm going to take damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. First and foremost, you take four points of slashing damage to your hand. You pull back, and there is a line of blood now, beginning to drip off your hand. You shake it amongst yourself.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm in Pelor's-- Sorry, Pelor.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Let's use a sword, I want to see how this plays out.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: God bless you. Gesundheit, Pelor. Man, all right. Well, jeez Louise.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Whip out the purple hand, man!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Seems like overkill. What about a Thunderwave? Can I do that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Certainly.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right. Does it only affect living things? Or does it affect--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Wait. Scanlan, are there any windows in there?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: There are. There are windows. Good call.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's a blast of thunderous energy in an area, it would affect living and nonliving matter, yes.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Hold on, this is stupid.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Are you sure?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We are going to the window. We are going to the window.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, let's carry this out.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No! We are going to the window. Please do not destroy the temple of Pelor.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Three hours later, we are still trying to open the door.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's not even locked. It's just heavy.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I can Bigby's Hand. I'll just Bigby's Hand.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Which way to the window? I can walk to the window.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's up there. You can make it, but Percy can't.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I can probably lift that door bar from inside.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You could, probably.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: With your help, son.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, but I could blast it. Would be very dramatic.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Let's save that for important stuff. All right, where is the window? Which way do I go?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: To the right and up.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They're broken a little higher up. So you could either continue to break the bottom part of the window, or just attempt to leap through the hole.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, I'll attempt to leap.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so give me an acrobatics check.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: The saga of the door!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's just a door, you guys! It's just a door.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You leap off that wall onto the small pillar that's holding the side of the window and up through the broken portion of the stained glass, landing, three-point landing, on the inside. You almost land in one of the shattered piles of wooden pews and splinters and jagged pieces of wood sticking out of it. About a foot away from you, and you are like, "Oh, that was close." You see Scanlan across the way. You see the altar to your right.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Hey! Oi! Your stupid idea cut my hand!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm going to try to help. Do you want to help me lift this thing?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: With my good hand, yes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Have both you guys make strength checks.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You know what, I'm going to get some assistance. I call my Unseen Servant to assist.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughs) Okay.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He is going to lift with us.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: With a brief burst of wind energy, a shimmering form, somewhat humanoid in shape, but still amorphous appears.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Hi, Darrell.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (wind sounds) and begins to shove itself up against the bottom of the wooden bar. Make your check, as well.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That was a six. Is that for me?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's for you, and then roll and add five for your Unseen Servant.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So, five extra to that is 11. Right? No?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Roll again, add five.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, I see. Four. So that's a nine.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: But this door bests you!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Man, Laura and Travis ain't missing shit!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right, I'm doing it. Step back!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Whip out the hand!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right, I summon Bigby's Hand! The mightiest hand that will ever unlock a door, ever! (singing) Bigby's Hand!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This giant, glimmering, purple fist appears in your vicinity. It grabs the bottom. Go ahead and roll a d20.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Come on.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Plus eight to it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Plus eight? 20!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: How do you want to do this?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: With its finger, just goes (ping) and it (thudding noises). The door (creak) opens up and Percy stands there, looking not very happy.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Was it overkill? Because really it took that.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It took three spells to open this door! Three spells!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's not overkill if you used what it took.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Three spells and I injured myself.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh god! Get it out of our system now!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Welcome, Percy.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh god! All right, I'm looking around, taking in the damage. Anything that I notice is particularly out of whack from the last time I was here? Other than they're upgrading the locks, apparently.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There is the altar on the top, and you do see, there is a couple of small sacks, laid to the side of the altar. What looks to be some low-lit candles, and there are some braziers. One to each side of the altar, and one against each wall. All of them appear to be long dark and out. Go ahead and make a perception check.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All of us?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All of you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Just a very faint glow of ember to it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What's the matter?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Reynal?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Who? Reynal?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Father Reynal? (louder) Father Reynal? Let's check one of the doors. We'll start on the door on the right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You step up. You can see now, on top of the altar, there appears to be a couple of glass vials that are overturned, a little liquid spilled. You can see bits of broken glass across the bottom, the one step that leads down from the altar's raised platform.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Can I dip and smell?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make an investigation check.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You get the feeling that the way that all this was treated, it wasn't so much like it was destroyed more than it was hastily packed up. Roll a perception check.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 20? Okay, looking about the outside of the altar, you do notice that around the brazier that is slightly smoldering there is a layer of ash there, gathered on the inside of the brazier and a little bit on the floor, around its base.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Someone has been working on something in here.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It couldn't just be ash from the thing that is burning?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The wood ash itself tends to fall; it's a little heavier. This seems to be a lighter shade of ash and it's more of a-- has found its way out of the brazier from just the heat and the air.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I want to smell the ash. Does it smell like some sort of-- is it perfumed?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You lean down and you take some of the ash in your fingers and smell it. It's not perfumed, but you've had some experience with dealing with various burning materials: this is definitely paper-based ash. You do also notice underneath the brazier there is one sliver of paper that was not wholly burned.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Paper.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (whispering) Paper.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's a golden ticket.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: "Regarding the weapon, after a year of taking notes from eyewitness accounts, my original designs were "faulty and recently cost me my hand. The wind of fortune has seen a shift it seems as Sylas just "returned from Emon, having encountered the still-living subject, and had the pleasure of "seeing his work first-hand. His unnatural eyes took in much detail. I believe his observations "have brought me to the brink of finishing my design. I intend to journey from Whitestone within "a couple of months to gather the components needed. But, if Delilah's hunch is correct, the "subject is heading here. I may find myself needing to leave sooner than anticipated."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: They're trying to copy your work.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Copy?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Why?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: For war.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I want to take another look at everything that was on the altar, and I want to see if it looks--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go ahead and make an investigation check.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Testing what's there: I mean, a lot of the material has been scattered and mixed but there are elements that resemble the black powder you've used in some of your constructs and tinkering in the past.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: They're making guns!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well, we know we're looking for someone without a hand.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: To do what?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: To find out who's trying to copy my work.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Someone who is working with Sylas, right?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yes. Let's check the rest of the temple.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay, I'm going to go up on the altar. Was there a small something on the altar?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What you noticed were like some of the glass vials that were overturned.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: What's in the pouches?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Looking at the pouches, it looks like some of them contained phosphorus, some of them contained other alchemical reagents that were used in the research but most have been emptied, and it's just a residuum on the inside.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Checking the door on the right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Door on the right.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Going with.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Long passed and left to fester beneath his bed.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Can I tell how he died?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Roll an investigation check.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Rapier-based. They're too long, like stiletto, too long to be a dagger.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Not teeth.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, they are inflicted by a weapon, a long thin weapon. And multiple to the torso.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to search the room for anything else. Search the body.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Searching the body, searching the room, it looks like everything of interest has been taken from the place. You find some leftover stale food, you find some candles that are generally used for the purposes of worship here in the temple, but anything beyond that-- all the drawers have been emptied, everything has been taken by whoever was previously setting up residence in this facility.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wasn't she gonna-- I don't know. Do some holy shit?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You do notice that, throughout the temple, there are images of Pelor, flame-wreathed face, various sun and stars that are set up, but most of them have been profaned, marked on, shattered, or covered in soot. An intentional effort has been made to dampen the power of Pelor in this once-holy place.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Are there any untouched?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: None that are untouched, but there are some that could possibly be cleaned. A couple of small medallions that are hanging up in the room where the Father lays.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'll snag those.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I want to check the other room. The room to the left.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a perception check.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: So much perception. 19.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. As you walk back into the main temple--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Finish. First.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Your ears catch a faint, distant sound like a strong wind pushing through a mountain pass. This low mournful wail-type sound.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What's that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No wind is moving. There is a stillness to the air.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Stepping back into the darkest shadows I can see.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you guys take in this sense, this sound gets louder and louder. At which point, the air itself gets colder and colder. As you nervously exhale, you can see your breath becoming visible in the air around you. As you all look at each other, you, stepping back into what shadows there are, as it is a very open temple, as it's a temple of sun--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: 32 stealth.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You find what tiny little alcove you can of shadow. It's not going to offer a lot of protection once you move, but for now you seem to be out of the circumstance.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I grab Percy, and I make us both go invisible.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So, what is that, a 3rd-level Invisibility spell?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. You guys both vanish, holding your place on top of the altar, and as that moaning tends to grow louder and louder you can see this shimmer at the doors that are open on the opposite side of the room. It looks like a woman. A form of a woman, but translucent in nature, drifting in, giving off the horrible (raspy groan) sound, as it drifts in and you see it looking around and the features are gaunt as it gets closer. It looks elven by racial nature, but the eyes are just these sunken faintly glowing sockets, the hair wild and matted and floating behind it, its hands reaching out, and as it gets partway through the temple, it looks like it's seeking something, and its eyes fall directly on you two.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm throwing a dagger right now.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Let's go ahead and--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Ugh! What if she was a good guy?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's a banshee, man.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What if it's a good banshee? Some of the banshees that I've met have been decent. We're rolling for initiative?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: There's Siouxsie and the Banshees, they're all right.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm glad I used half my spells trying to get into this goddamn place.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Off to the side there.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: He means well.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: He means well. That's a terrible costume.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys are on the altar there.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You were so prepared for me to go to the temple that you built it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I built the whole city, because I didn't know where you guys were going to go.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Jesus, Matt!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: MATT Shh! Don't look at it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm not looking, I'm not looking.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm just noting the pile.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So, first and foremost, let's go ahead and roll initiative.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You'll get a surprise round.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Dope.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Natural 20 for initiative, as well.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You finally got a good initiative roll!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I got a seven.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I don't know what's up.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, I can't do anything.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, well. First and foremost, before anything happens, this entity, as it notices your presence, it begins to transform and its image becomes more horrifying. As you pull your dagger out, I need all of you guys to roll a wisdom saving throw.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You have advantage!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I rolled a one and then a natural 20.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughs) Nice.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Thank you for the advantage.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You're welcome.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Scanlan?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: With advantage?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I also always have advantage, so do I get to roll a third time?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No. Doesn't stack.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Unfortunately you are considered frightened by this entity. It scares the crap out of you.

lines.name: MARISHA, TALIESIN
lines.text: You can't be frightened after a Heroes' Feast.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Ah! Then never mind. You feel it shake your form for a second. Its horrible visual presence, for a second, freaks you out, but then you remember the knowledge that your friends are here and you have to serve a purpose and you shake off--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Not only do I shake it off, I gird my loins!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Pull them up and get ready. All right.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Just for a refresher: you're immune to poison, disease, and fear, and you have advantage on your wisdom throws.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We should do this every time we fly.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's expensive.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: So, do I get to attack and then move into the combat round where I got a natural 20 plus five for initiative?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, you go first. Technically, it's not a surprise round because the creature can sense life and saw them before it happens, so it wasn't ambushed. But you do get to go first, and you do get to go before it. In the use of surprise, I didn't mean to use it in the surprise round fashion. These entities can detect living creatures up to five miles away.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: So, there's no sneak attack damage on this thing, is there?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If you get to it first, you still have advantage.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Because it doesn't see you. You're still hidden from it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: 15, so this is a 26 to hit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That hits.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay. And this gets the sneak attack damage?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This would, yes.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: All right, here we go. But it's not a critical hit from assassinate because--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It is not surprised.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm just going to keen dagger it three times in a row. Oh, I've got to roll to attack, so that is a twelve plus-- 22?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Hits.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay. Two, and that is six of damage, and then natural 20 on that one. That is three, four, three, plus seven is ten, so 20 for that, if it's doubled for a critical hit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: For double dice, not doubled modifier.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, all right, so six plus-- 13.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, 13, good to know. Awesome. So, out of the shadows, (whoosh) three daggers strike this wailing ghost entity. Each dagger, it punctures, and you see it reacts from the impact as there's a flash of magical energy with each hit. The daggers then tumble out of its form and then blink back to your belt side. It looks like it definitely did some damage to it, but it's--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You know what, just to be fair, I changed out all my daggers except for one, so I probably couldn't throw the same dagger three times in a row, so I think should pull back some of the modifiers, so I would pull out four, because my dagger is plus two. So the plus two for two of those hits gets taken out, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It would actually, yes.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: So four, minus four.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So, minus four damage to this other guy.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: So truthful.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So, we're fighting it with wooden stakes?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Wait so you threw wooden stakes at it as two of the attacks?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I threw one dagger and two wooden stakes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. So, the first dagger hits?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: First was the dagger, yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. The two other stakes pass through its form without any other impact. The one dagger does return to you, but the two stakes just clatter in the distance, and the creature seems unharmed by those two.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Even though they came out of the belt?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sorry.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's okay. It's just wood.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You learned.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So that ends that point. The creature now swoops up to the center of you three and gives out this horrible (roar) this wailing scream that bursts out in the air, you feel like the wind push you back and all of you feel like for a moment you're staring at your own death. I need all three of you guys to roll constitution saving throws.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Does our meal help us with that at all?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nope.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Wait, don't forget you have the additional--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: 2d10 hit points on top.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay. 16.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Both of you guys, you feel this chilling burst of spiritual energy blast through your soul. And you each take 14 points of psychic damage. Percy, however, as you look at it, it seems like this blast actually forces the soul from your body momentarily. You immediately drop to zero hit points and are unconscious.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What? No! No, he can't. Oh, god.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So with that, you see Percy, eyes roll back and then collapse onto the floor like a pile of cold bones. Out. Percy, it's your turn. Go ahead and make a death saving throw.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 11, okay.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's a good sign.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Scanlan, it's your turn.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Very quickly. Should we flee?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Get the fuck out.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: In a little bit.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: In a little bit? Okay.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Without Percy?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Well, get him up.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You still have Bigby's Hand, by the way, on concentration.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, that's right!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Let's see how long that lasts, actually. Let me see how long it lasts. Just to be safe.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (whispering) God damn it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Up to a minute. So probably would have faded by now.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: God damn it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sorry. What are you doing, Scanlan?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Really, it's the door's fault.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Whatever it is.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. So you release a bolt of lightning energy right in its direction. Go ahead and roll damage for that.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, just damage?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You don't have to hit for lightning bolt; it just hits everything in front of it, and you have to try and avoid it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, 8d6.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What's the DC?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do I get my hand cone?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It is a free action to pull it out, so you instinctively-- hand cone, cast the spell-- out the bolt goes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 19, okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Does not make its saving throw.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Great.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Need more d6, or are you cool?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Nope, that's it. I just need help counting.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's good!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: However, it does take damage.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And I will-- Oh! We have people.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yay! Percy's unconscious!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Keep fighting!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's okay, it's cool.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We've been listening in the car.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Okay, so you know.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Scanlan, you move back?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay, and then I can, as a bonus action, still get a bonus? I will heal him, this doofus here.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I didn't do anything!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Healing Word.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay, yeah. (singing) I'm bring health points back. Yeah! You mothafuckas don't know how to act-- Yeah! That's all I got. (singing) Take it to the bridge!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so Healing Word is 1d4 plus--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, but maybe I should do it at a--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Just get me up. It's okay.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Just get you up? Okay. 1d4 plus something?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Two plus whatever. Six? Eight?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I think it's plus your spell level.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Healing Word will be--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's 1d4 plus five, so it's seven points.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So, seven hit points. You're conscious, but you're still on the ground, face down, loosely fallen over the stuff on the altar.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I don't get my turn until next round.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Correct. So, Scanlan? Your turn's done? Vax, you're up.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: All right, so where is it? I'm just going to back away from it about three steps, while I pull Flametongue Dagger out of my cloak.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You're in this room currently.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, oh! That, oh, okay. No. So, I'm going to walk, thanks. I'm going to slide up the wall along where Scanlan is. Towards Scanlan. And another thing I realized, I haven't clicked my Boots of Haste, so I wouldn't have been able to do whoosh, whoosh, whoosh, anyway. And I'm still not going to. But I'm pulling out my Flametongue Dagger and now I'm throwing Keen Dagger, Flametongue. First one is 26.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Hits.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And the second one is 23.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Hits.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay. First attack gets 11.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And the second attack gets eight.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All righty. Both daggers hitting it, you see its form being impacted by each dagger hit. It still continues to come forward toward the two of you. Is that the end of your movement?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm going to, without doing any dash or anything, because I can't, I'm going to move as far as I can just going kitty-corner. Behind Scanlan, walking along the wall.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Over here?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Absolutely.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That far?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, that's as far as I can get, that's good.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What's your AC?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You take 12 points of necrotic damage.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm back to zero.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's two!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It starts over.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It does?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah. I'm back to zero.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: If he dies once, comes back and dies again, is that two?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, he has to fail his death saves.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I just woke up and went, (groans). Passed back out again.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That ends its turn. Go ahead and make your death saving throw.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yes, 19.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yay, little snitch.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All righty. That ends your turn. Scanlan, you're up.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Hey, should we leave?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No, we should kill this thing!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Damn it! All right.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We're not going to be able to run. This thing flew in here on the breeze.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I don't think Eyebite's going to work against it. So, fuck, I'll cast Bigby's Hand at 6th-level, then.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughing) Okay!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Has that ever been done?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I don't have any more 5th-level slots. So, I'm just going to make it even bigger.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All righty.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I don't even know what it does.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Fingers going out the windows of the church like Alice in Wonderland.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Bigby's Hand. With a clenched fist deals an additional 2d8 damage.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So if you're going to punch it, it does an additional 2d8 damage.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes, I think--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What are you going to do?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Possibly to the front door.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, I see. So it does no damage but it does force its movement.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, and I'll say because you did it at a higher level, it's an additional five feet of movement on that. So, as the hand shoves toward the creature--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It takes no damage for that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The forceful hand it doesn't, no. There's grasping hand and the clenched fist do damage.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right, so then I'll just hit it. I'll just hit it hard.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go ahead and roll a d20, add your spell attack modifier.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: 14. Plus, what am I adding? Oh, nine. Plus nine.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 14 plus nine? That hits. Go ahead and roll damage. That's 6d8 force damage because you cast it at 6th level.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: 6d8. I don't even know what those are. That's a ten.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: They look like diamonds.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: There they go. I got one. I'll just roll it six times.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (singing) Diamonds are Scanlan's best friend.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, diamonds are Vex's best friend.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Even at 6th-level, that's all it did.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. As that happens, the fist clenches and (wham) bitch-slaps the back of the wailing ghost creature. As it does you hear it scream out in pain (screech) as its spectral form is scattered across the air and dissipates.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Thank god.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I think you smashed it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You killed it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You crushed it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: But I'm so little and wee!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Lift yourself up for a victory lap.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, that was a great idea.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You toss yourself up a couple times.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Whoa!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Meanwhile, Percy's unconscious.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh shit! Percy!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No, I've got four healing potions. I pour, it's not the best. It's a greater healing?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So, it's 4d4 plus four.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I will also sing for him a Song of Rest, which is just another d6.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If you guys are taking a short rest--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah. Oh, are we clear of danger?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We don't know, but I poured the potion into Percy's mouth.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: 4d4 plus four?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yep, you got it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yep. I'm awake. Hurt, but--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I slap him twice, anyway.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Ugh! Ah!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What do we do?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What are we doing here?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: The priest's dead. Is there anyone else, or should we head back?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We should head back. Apparently, any help I thought we'd find here is obviously gone.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Should we check this other room first, before we go?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Did we not check the other room?

lines.name: SAM, LIAM
lines.text: No.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Let's check the other room, and--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Quickly, though, quickly.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We'll check the other room quickly.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: While they check the room, I'm going to go all over the altar and see if there's anything, any hidden door, any trapdoor, anything like that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, go ahead and make a perception check.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Eh. That's a-- oh! No! Wait, I keep forgetting that's a rogue skill. That's a 20.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I was really hoping you missed that part.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Looking over the altar, it appears to be smooth, solid stone. Nothing catches your attention. You check the other room. This is a small kitchen, essentially, for whoever was running here would make small meals or things to delineate during worship and/or just cook for its own meals when the father was keeping--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Has it been used recently? Is it--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: SAM I'm going to look around as well and food and stuff.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You get the feeling that the last time this was used was a little under a week ago.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Any provisions that we can take? Water, food?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You find a couple of loaves of stale bread, some dried meats, salted dry meats, like some jerky-ish type things. Things that are meant to last a while. There is produce here, but the produce has long wilted and gone to rot.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I have theories on who's been using this space. Is there anything that would clue me in to who's been using this space?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Whoever left the notes, and whoever was dabbling with the vicinity does have a tendency towards sciences and alchemy in ways that seemingly can blend and overlap with your specialty. That's the best you can ascertain, based on the information given.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Now, here's the question. Do we leave them a sign that we're here, or do we hope that they don't notice?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, let's leave them a sign. We're supposed to be sowing discontent, right? So, let's leave a sign that someone was here and fucked up their shit. Do you want me to pee on the altar?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I take my dagger, and I go to the altar--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Wait.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, don't leave your dagger; it's your only one left.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I didn't say I'm leaving it. Yeah. You want that?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I want that.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I start-- would you hand me that scrap of paper, yeah?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Whoa, this is our sign?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: So I start carving this-- Is this Pelor?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: This is not Pelor. It's part of the crest of de Rolo.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Ooh!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: de Rolos are back!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay. So, I just start scraping it into the stone with the Keen Dagger.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. And it gives a horrible screeching sound as you carve into this well-polished stone surface that's used predominantly for worship, or when it was. Given about five, ten minutes in you manage to scrape a design into it that is visually distinct against the smooth surface, and does match the design best to your ability that Percy--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I would also like to drag Father Reynal out of his room and put him at the pedestal.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And then before we go, I'm going to the wooden door, and I carve into the door: Pelor lives in Whitestone.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's a lot of words.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Six hours later...

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's wood! It took me five minutes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You finish your carving, seemingly without recurring incident.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Like to head back now, I believe.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. You guys make your way out of the temple back into the center of the graveyard. The sun is beginning to set. The reds and purples of the night sky are starting to creep in, as it just begins to crest on the far western side of the mountain range surrounding the valley.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What's the weather been like since we've been in Whitestone?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's been spotty, cloudy--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: The sun has come out during the daytime?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Bits and pieces. There is heavy cloud cover that seems to be pushing through. It brings colder weather. It looks like when you first got there, there was some snowfall that happened before you arrived. You've had a few days of sun, but I'd say about half the day is cloud cover.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Does it seem to be fairly natural weather for this time of year? Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And this far north, too. All right. You guys--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I also grab those wooden stakes off the ground.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Takes you a little time, because they're amongst a bunch of other broken wooden scraps--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I grab a couple extra, as well.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay! You find some splintered wood. You guys make your way back into the town. I'd like you all to make a stealth, or a deception check, if you prefer.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Deception, please. (sings a ditty) I'm just a peasant boy.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: G'day sir.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. As you guys are making your way back towards the tavern, there is a small group of Whitestone villagers walking and having a conversation. Not heated, but there is a sense of desperate conversation amongst them. And, standing with them you can see there's an older gentleman, mostly bald, long scraggly gray hair that falls past his shoulders, a little bit hunched. He's wearing dark leathers and a cloak that's over one shoulder and drags the ground behind him. And they're talking to him and he's growling to himself and the best you can make out is there's an argument about farming shipments and the inability to make dates and requirements. He shouts back to the remainder, says, "Listen, it is beyond my control. This is what has been decreed "by Sir Kerrion. That is how it'll be. If you cannot provide, then taxes will be pulled. If you "cannot pay, then there are far worse things we can take. Now, be on your way!" And steps away from the group, looks over and sees a little boy and this in the shadows skulking individual. "You there!"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yes?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "You new around here?"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: A bit, yes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I don't recognize you." And two of the guards step forward.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I suppose it's our good luck, then.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "What's your name?"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (sighs) Reggie.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a deception check.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Fuck my life. I know! 21!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: My name's Reggie.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Then make yourself useful. Maybe you can make up for some of these lost crops that these "bags of shite keep saying they can't do."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm actually supposed to be going back for a--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I don't give a shit, move on, boy."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yes, sir.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Night has taken the sky and Keyleth is on the verge of completing her ritual.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm cleaning my nails as I'm watching her.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm keeping an eye from the second floor. I want to see how much movement in the city there is and whether or not there's any guards by the tree, whether or not the tree seems to be left to its own devices.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. As you're keeping watch, you notice occasionally there will be one of the zombie giants that will lumber through the center of town. There's a very specific pattern that they tend to follow.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Definitely trying to memorize that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And you do notice a couple of other guards that you didn't notice during the day begin to show up. They're humanoid; they're armored. They sneak around. They're humanoid, but their movement is unnatural.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Is there a lot of light in the town, or not very much light?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Not very much light at all. There's very low-lit points at certain crossroads that've been left up for general visibility for those who have to travel at night, but you gather most people just do not travel at night here in Whitestone.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Make sure no lights are lit in our--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We've already blacked out--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I blacked out the windows.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Keyleth--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You finally complete your ritual. Sweat pouring down your brow, you have your hand on the roots--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can I do something? Something real quick for my final, extra drama? So, as I complete the ritual, remembering that Pelor, and this is a sun tree. I'm going to cast my 6th-level Sunbeam spell as I'm finishing the Plant Growth with the last big essence--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: At night?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And shove it in the tree.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You're going to shove it where the sun don't shine.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, I'm going to kill it. I don't know if it's going to work or not.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Roll a d20 and add your wisdom modifier.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do I get advantage on this? Because of Heroes' Feast?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I would say no, because this isn't a saving throw and because what you're attempting to do is essentially convert a highly damaging spell into a non-damaging circumstance at the end of an eight-hour endurance match with a ritual. This is going to be a difficult attempt. So go ahead and roll a d20. Add your wisdom modifier.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I hope I didn't just fuck up by doing this.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You got it, Keyleth.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, you never get arrested or anything, you're good.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Use the green one. This is you doing greenery.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm so nervous.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Natural 20. Easy. Or a six.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, no.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: But my wisdom's not bad, so 12?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You complete the ritual and release the healing energy of your Plant Growth spell. As you release it you begin to concentrate on the sun ray and you begin to see, throughout the pieces of earth around, seeds quickly begin to germinate and small little bits of ivy, greenery begin to pierce out from parts of the earth in your immediate vicinity, as this affects a large radius. There does not appear to be any sort of immediate reaction by the tree. You begin to pull back and concentrate on the spell. You release the Sunbeam forward. In the frustration of the lack of reaction from the tree and the desperation to make sure some effect happens, you release the full force of the beam as opposed to the prequel aspect and you burst into some of the roots, blasting some of them apart and beginning to set flame to part of the under of the tree.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, cool. That's cool. Cool story.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Bucket of water.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'll put it out.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys hear this (explosion).

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's right in front of-- I pull out my cloaks in my bag and start trying to put out the flames. Keyleth, what? Was that supposed to happen? Is that good? Was this good? Should I stop? I keep putting out the flames.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You put out the flames. And you notice where the fire had burned aspects of the wood, there is the black char marks across the roots where the flames touched, and the area surrounding the root is a little more of a vibrant brown color. Almost like a little hint of life seemed to have seeped into the root.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh my god.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It expands for a moment and you can see a little bit of life return to that localized section of the tree.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Ooh! Like starting a fire. (blows air) Go, go! Can I Druidcraft? Come on!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And you begin to notice all the greenery begins to immediately wither and crumple and turn to ash. And you watch as the vibrant aspect of the roots slowly drain from the bottom up. Like something is pulling the life force out of the roots.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: They're sucking the life force out of the earth.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I take some of that holy oil that Vax gave me and I dip my finger in it and start rubbing it along the vines that are growing along the edge of the roots.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You take the holy oil and place it along the roots, and it soaks into the dry and in some cases now charred aspects of the roots. You wait a moment, and the oil seems to almost burn off and evaporate.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So, the ground is cursed.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: The ground is cursed.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, poo.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Should I try peeing on it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a perception check.

lines.name: MARISHA
